message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15000. This is a great deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better price anywhere else.
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $8000. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm afraid I can't accept $8000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $12000. This is a fair price considering the product's value and quality.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider $9500?

I understand that you're still a bit above your budget, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession. I can offer you the product for $11000. This is as low as I'm willing to go, considering the product's value and my costs.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider $9000?

I understand that you're still trying to get the best deal, Bob. However, I'm getting close to my minimum acceptable price. I can offer you the product for $10500. This is the lowest I'm willing to go, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else.

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that I might not be able to get a better deal. I'm willing to meet you at $8500, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. Please let me know if this is acceptable to you.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Bob. However, I'm still not comfortable with $8500. I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer you the product for $9200. This is my final offer, and I'm confident it's the best deal you'll get.
I'm not willing to go any higher than $8600. This is my final offer. Please let me know if you're willing to accept it.
